Mousse

CHOCOLATE AVOCADO PROTEIN MOUSSE

A surprisingly rich and creamy chocolate mousse made with avocado and 18g of protein. A healthy and decadent treat.

18g
Protein
280
Calories
10m
Total Time
2
Yield
Recipe Ingredients Instructions Troubleshooting Substitutions Nutrition Panel
DOWNLOAD PDF PACK
Free Resource

GET THE PRINTABLE PACK

Includes shopping list (grams), freezer guide, and the substitution matrix PDF.

DOWNLOAD PDF PACK

INGREDIENTS

  • 45g chocolate plant-based protein powder
  • 1 ripe avocado
  • 60ml unsweetened almond milk
  • 30g unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 10g maple syrup or other sweetener to taste

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

1

Blend Ingredients

In a blender, combine the protein powder, avocado, almond milk, cocoa powder, and sweetener.

2

Blend Until Smooth

Blend on high until the mixture is completely smooth and creamy.

3

Chill

Pour the mousse into individual serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to set.

4

Serve

Serve chilled, garnished with chocolate shavings or fresh berries.

5

Storage

Store any leftover mousse in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

Serving is too dry

Try reducing baking time by 2-3 minutes, or add an extra tablespoon of Greek yogurt to the batter.

Not rising properly

Check that your baking powder is fresh (less than 6 months old). Also avoid overmixing the batter.

Gummy texture in center

This usually means under-baking. Use a toothpick to test - it should come out with just a few moist crumbs.

Too dense

Make sure you're measuring protein powder correctly. Too much protein powder can make baked goods dense.

PRO TIPS

üí°

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

üí°

For best results, use a kitchen scale to measure ingredients in grams.

üí°

Let cool completely before storing to prevent sogginess.
